metadata.title: CVE-2017-6498 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in ImageMagick 6.9.7. Incorrect TGA files couldtrigger assertion failures, thus leading to DoS.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6498` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.6
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.6
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.6
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.6
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.6
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.6
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.6
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.6
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.6
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.6
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.6
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.6
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.6
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.6').
